history.content: I'm a TA for 186 so I might be biased: I feel 186 is probably more difficult in terms of workload, but I also think 186 is a lot more important in terms of the knowledge you gain. Some companies do ask more low level system questions and 186 can be helpful in regards to that (although 162 is prob more directly relevant).

children.subject:
I have taken both, and here is my two cents:

If you are familiar with linear algebra, calculus and stats concepts, Data 100 shouldn't be too bad as it requires a lot less actual coding experiences and more mathematical intuitions (sure you could get by without them but that's the entire point of the course). 186 has a lot more actual coding, and you need to worry about lower-stack concepts like I/O's and different sorting/hashing methods, but there isn't as much math involved so I found it to be easier to follow. The projects were quite long, but were relatively easy as long as you know the materials. 

tl;dr: Good at math, Data 100 easier; not so good at math and doesn't want to spend too much time on math, 186 easier.

history.content: Which class has a lighter workload? I am planning to have a busy semester on top of recruiting, so I don't want to burn myself. Thanks in advance!
history.subject: CS 186 vs. Data 100?
